thread.title: How to add the recepionist fro Mars City?

post.author: Dingo_aus
post.body:
I a newbie at Doom3 (didn't see alpha or anything like that)

So my question is How do I add the Mars City Recepionist Model. I can place the entity but it shows in the editor without a head and I can't seem to place one on it. And in game not even the body shows up.

Any idea on how to add this model with animations just like in the game?

post.author: Vash
post.body:
Basically, almost all models show up-editor without a head. You'll need to compile and playtest to see it with a head. You can use whatever animation you want be going to the entities properties and scrolling through the animations list at the bottom.

I got this working. Basically, I put in a func_static with a chair model, then put in marscity_recetionist2. I aligned it a bit to look like he was on the chair.



It isnt complete, he is typing on a keyboard that isnt there - and he collides a bit with the chair - but you can fix it up.

Download Map [Right click + Save as...](ignore the zombie and stuff - that was for another test =P).

post.author: amusedtoe
post.body:
SonicClang wrote:
Actually the chair is part of the model. But for some reason it disappears once you kill the guy. No fun I like killing the receptionist.


In my map the chair stays when I kill em, it's a moveable too.

To rotate them use the degree buttons in the bottom left corner of the entity window. If those angles don't suit you just change the number to one of your own. You may also have to delete any rotation key that ended up on it when you were trying to rotate it, still don't know if that's universal or not but it doesn't work for me otherwise.

post.author: Wykyd_1
post.body: I think i know why this happens, I discovered that if you place a movable on the "floor" of your map with the point of the model touching the brush then when moved it will dissapear into it. I place moveables 1 or even .5 grid units away from the brush and they work fine.

post.author: critanime
post.body: I did some expeimentation on this matter and found that at times it also can have someting to do with the caulk texture. The caulk texture as far as i understand it tell the engine not to do anything with it. So you are basically left with a patch. I found that if something is thrown into a patch hard enough it will actually go through the patch in a sort of a bug state.
